content: hello crafters welcome to my spaceship of the imagination in my special
spaceship we can craft and make anything but today we are going to make some
nasty alien eggs so let's go to our table and start crafting those alien
eggs you
hey guys here's what I'm going to use to make the eggs
this stuff's called Crayola model magic and I really like it for several reasons
one is it's fairly inexpensive it's an air dry clay but it doesn't get hard
like a standard air dry it's kind of rubbery so it has a nice tough texture I
won't break or crack and I really like that so let's get the table and start
sculpting those eggs here's my model magic and I keep it in a jar to keep it
fresh and you can keep the excess in the jar here I'm rolling it up into an egg
shape got that I'm going to use a cheap sculpting tool with a blade on it and
just kind of sculpt the folds in the top of the egg find this a little bit put it
a little egg shape and I'm going to put a toothpick in there because I need to
get some texture on this I'm going to use a sanding sponge and just kind of
roll it over that and that'll put some nice texture on that egg for me let's
define those folds a little bit more and it's all set it's all ready to go now
the next egg here I'm going to do is I'm going to do an open top one so I'm going
to cut those a little bit and pinch out those folds somewhat so I can get that
at open egg shape and I'm to use a probe and just poke into the egg to get the
open egg to find those folds a little bit more and put the texture on
there we go it's all set for the bases I'm going to use these washers and these
are not quite an inch but I'm going to secure them to this pad first this piece
of paper that way I can do the detail on the washers first before I then add the
eggs and this will secure them keep the washers from moving around I'm just
cleaning up a little bit so now I'm adding the texture I'm just using my
small glue gun and just pulling out from the center and that will give a nice
kind of texture to the bottom of the egg and I'll just continue to do that with
the other pieces and that will be ready to go for the next step here I've got
the egg and I'm going to put some glue on the bottom I was a little messy on
the bottom because I want some of that little a little bit of glue to go up
onto the egg itself there we go we just finish up and you
see I'm just putting it generously on there now I'm going to help secure these
a little bit with some white glue this is not necessary but it just gives a
little bit of strength extra strength to add to secure it to the base now let
those dry so here we go I painted my spray
painting my egg black and I have my green paint like green paint you could
really use any light green paint here I go and I'm kind of I went to paint quite
a bit and it's almost like a wash so see there you go now let that dry and I'm
going to use another green it's a slightly different green you'll be able
to see on my palette here the difference between the two the other ones a little
brighter so I'm just going to take that and just give it some highlight a bit
and hit the sides a little a little darker and the base is also
now here I'm going to add some red ochre and this will give a little variation in
color on the egg itself so I'm going to do it very wet like a wash so I'm not
trying to cover up the green just accent it with a bit of a different color now
I'm doing the inside of these eggs with a with a peach color or a salmon I
should say so more of a salmon color now I'm going to accentuate the folds in the
egg with some very watered-down black and also on the base if you if it gets a
little out of control you can wipe it off with your finger same with the open
egg just pull out those folds and the base
I want to make the eggs glossy I'm going to use this mini wax water-based acrylic
and here I have a cutting board to keep the mess down now I'm going to use the
acrylic and just brush it on make sure you don't get it too thick or it can get
a little translucent so I want to keep it transparent and just glossy on the
surface so I just cover those up with that water base gloss
sargent the glass door is closed we must open the blast door to enter oh I can
help Baldrick what are you doing here you're in the wrong John rrah
oh sorry alright let's get that door open men
all right let's check out the room one of these interesting objects let's go
check them out all right let's file in hmm let's
examine these okay look a little closer to this one my face getting up a face so
here we go here's an egg and I think they came out really great has a nice
variation in color that folds are really accentuated on the top here's an open
egg so that a little bit of salmon color in there just gives it the difference to
differentiate it from the other eggs and there we go with stabilizers whoa there
we go hey guys I hope you enjoyed the alien egg video if you liked the video
please give me a like if you would like to join others who enjoy crafting as
much as we do make sure to join my forum the links in the description below and
also I have a Facebook group we'd love to have you and keep crafting and
remember know one can hear your cracking in space
